meanings.definition: Things that cause trouble or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Carrying heavy bags can lead to inconveniencies during travel.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected rainstorm brought inconveniencies to our outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can result in inconveniencies.
meanings.sent4: Inconveniencies are like unexpected roadblocks on the path to success.
meanings.sent5: The constant construction noise outside created inconveniencies for the residents.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inconvenient.
meanings.sent1: The inconveniencies of having a broken phone charger are frustrating.
meanings.sent2: She was annoyed by the inconveniencies of having to wait in long lines.
meanings.sent3: The inconveniencies of a slow internet connection made online gaming impossible.
meanings.sent4: Living far away from the grocery store adds inconveniencies to daily errands.
meanings.sent5: The inconveniencies of a power outage became apparent during the storm.
